questions.question: What war was fought between British and French colonists over the Ohio River Valley?

choices.answer: War of 1812
French and Indian War
War of Jenkins' Ear
French and British War

questions.question: Which document forbid British colonists from living west of the Appalachian mountains?

choices.answer: Resolution of 1765
Declaration of Independence
Proclamation of 1774
Proclamation of 1763

questions.question: Which of the following is the best explanation for Britain's response to the Boston Tea Party?

choices.answer: They passed a series of laws as punishment against them
They sent troops to Massachusetts almost immediately
They placed a tax on all legal documents in the colonies
They ignored the colonists, hoping they would dissolve

questions.question: At which meeting were there no representatives from Georgia present?

choices.answer: Signing of the Declaration of Independence
Meeting of the Second Continental Congress
Meeting of First Continental Congress
Protest of the Stamp Act

questions.question: Which of the following best explains the reason the Liberty Boys were founded?

choices.answer: In protest of the Intolerable Acts
In protest of the Boston Tea Party
To support the Sugar Act
In protest of the Stamp Act

questions.question: Which of the following provisions of the Intolerable Acts was the only one to affect GA?

choices.answer: Closing of ports
Appointment of all gov't officials by the royal governor
Housing of British soldiers in colonists' homes
Changing of trials from the colonies to Great Britain

questions.question: Which of the following Georgians did NOT sign the Declaration of Independence?

choices.answer: Lymon Hall
Button Gwinnett
George Walton
Austin Dabney

questions.question: What is true about the Battle of Kettle Creek?

choices.answer: It was a colonist victory &  boosted morale and weapons
It was the last battle of the revolution to happen in GA
It was a decisive victory for the Britain & hurt morale
It was the only battle of the revolution to happen in GA

questions.question: What is the significance of Elijah Clarke in GA history?

choices.answer: He was a British traitor who was executed in Savannah
He was a Patriot leader who  fought at Kettle Creek
He was the first governor elected after the Am. Revolution
He was a slave who led a revolt in the 1760s

questions.question: Which Georgia county is named after a woman who was a heroine of the Revolutionary War?

choices.answer: Hall County-- Nancy Hall
Harris County-- Elizabeth Harris
Hart County-- Nancy Hart
Haralson County-- Mary Haralson

questions.question: Which statement best describes how the French and Indian War led to the Revolutionary War?

choices.answer: England took control of Canada & put their taxes on colonies
France lost the Louisiana Territory & the Southern colonies
France incited rebellion & got Spain to attack  the south
G.B. was in debt after war & imposed taxes on colonies

questions.question: Which of the following was a weakness of the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: It allowed for a very powerful executive branch
The court systems it established were very formal
It lacked power to enforce taxes on the states
The legislative branch had all the checks and balances

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Georgia's ratification of the Constitution?

choices.answer: Georgia unanimously voted down the Constitution
Georgia unanomously voted for the Constitution
Georgia didn't send any delegates to the Convention
Georgia only adopted the Bill of Rights in the Constitution

questions.question: Which of the following signed the Constitution at the Convention for Georgia?

choices.answer: Button Gwinnett, George Walton
Abraham Baldwin, James Madison
Nancy Hart, Elijah Clarke
Abraham Baldwin, William Few

questions.question: What is in the Bill of Rights?

choices.answer: Freedom of press
Right to bear arms
Right to a trial by jury
All of the above

questions.question: What is the best description of how the Constitution "fixed" problems from the Art. of Conf.

choices.answer: It gave more power to the states
It weakened the executive branch of government
It gave the federal government more power
It denied equal access under the law to women
